授業目的:
The purpose of this course is to guide students in gaining practical understanding of intercultural communication as a necessary, targeted response to the opportunities and difficulties that are currently emerging in the global corporate environment.

This course offers an introduction to core ideas of intercultural communication and their applications to a wide range of circumstances.
到達目標:
Upon completion of this course, students will be able to:

Demonstrate a critical appreciation of diverse social, cultural, and sub-cultural identities relevant to contexts for intercultural communication;

Discover the complexity of communication in an intercultural communication exchange;

Making and justifying decisions that impact on the work and learning of people from diverse social and cultural backgrounds.
授業方法: Instruction methods used in this course will include interactive seminars, self-assessment, group discussions, and case discussions in small groups and an entire class.  Learning in this course requires participants’ proactive participation and dedicated involvement in both class and group discussions.  Small group discussion, especially, is a key function in which to increase participants to learn throughout this course.  Thus, participants will be encouraged to share their views and ideas with other members actively.
